title: Nemesis
summary: In ancient Greek religion, Nemesis,[lower-alpha 1] also called Rhamnousia or Rhamnusia (Ancient Greek: Ῥαμνουσία, romanized: Rhamnousía, lit. 'the goddess of Rhamnous'[1]), is the goddess who enacts retribution against those who succumb to hubris, arrogance before the gods.[2]
